thread.title_full: After Oxford, Merriam-Webster Dictionary Adds Over 1,000 New Slang Words To Its List! - Indiatimes.com

title: After Oxford, Merriam-Webster Dictionary Adds Over 1,000 New Slang Words To Its List! - Indiatimes.com
text:
February 09, 2017 278 SHARES 
Merriam-Webster dictionary has now officially added over a thousand new words to its online dictionary. The list of new slangs was released on February 7. 
A range of these new-age words include binge-watch, face-palm, NSFW, and even FLOTUS. 
Let's take a look at some of the most interesting ones here. 1. binge-watch 
Definition: to watch many or all episodes of (a TV series) in rapid succession. 
geek and sundry 2. Photobomb 
Definition: to move into the frame of a photograph as it is being taken as a joke or prank. 
tackk 3. NSFW 
Definition: not safe for work; not suitable for work - used to warn someone that a website, e-mail attachment, etc., is not suitable for viewing at most places of employment. 
IndieWire 4. Humblebrag 
Definition: to make a seemingly modest, self-critical, or casual statement or reference that is meant to draw attention to one's admirable or impressive qualities or achievements. 
daily telegraph 
Definition: a person who is 110 years old or older 
c2w.com 
Definition: the first lady of the United States - often used like a nickname. 
getty images 7. Face-palm 
Definition: to cover one's face with the hand as an expression of embarrassment, dismay, or exasperation. 
imgur
